item.title: Data Visualization Matplotlib
item.description: Following a review of basic plotting with Matplotlib, this chapter delves into customizing plots using Matplotlib. This includes overlaying plots, making subplots, controlling axes, adding legends and annotations, and using different plot styles. import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import numpy as np import pandas as pd dry =[0.33,0.27,0.32,0.41,0.42,0.45,0.57,0.52,0.45,0.39,0.37,0.37] wet = [0.66,0.72,0.67,0.58,0.57,0.54,0.42,0.47,0.54,0.60,0.62,0.62] t = np.arange(1,13) plt.plot(t, dry, "red") plt.plot(t, wet, "blue") # Appear on the same axes plt.xlabel("Date") plt.title("dry vs. wet") plt.show()
